channel.title: [PI] How to change Npc drop rates [PI]
channel.description:
heey i need to change drop rates for the dynamic Pk source
there is a npcdrop.cfg but it isnt like delta it is realy weird and there is a NPCdrop.TSM
and in there there are things like (item):(amount) but not the ratio like this
[code]#growler 6250:50 995:30000 886:120 207:2 808:100 563:50 385:3 11730:1 11710:1 11712:1 11714:1 11710:1 11712:1 15050:1[/code]
how can i change ratio :s

item.title: [PI] How to change Npc drop rates [PI]
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

6250:50

change the 50. That is your drop rate

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] How to change Npc drop rates [PI]

item.title: [PI] How to change Npc drop rates [PI]
item.dc:creator: @labeeb labeeb
item.description:
@labeeb wrote:

#Man drops
1:60 995:200 4151:1

This is the solution:

1 = NPC
60 = Random Number (1 in 60 for every Item ID that has a “1” beside it)

995 = ID (Money)
4151 = ID (Whip)

So what program does is:

It will pick a number between 1 in 60,

It will select a random number between 1 in 60 for item 995 (1 Gold), if that number matches, drop 1 gold. Repeat this 200 Times (You should expect 200/60 … 3 Gold)

For the second ITEM… The whip, It will only generate a random number 1ce. If that matches, drop a whip. (1/60 odds).

If you didn’t understand what any of this meant,

The first two numbers are the only thing you need to know (NPC:DROPRATE), and the second number will tell you the chance of getting a drop (1 in Drop Rate). Just don’t add too many items or the chances in the drop table will stack.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] How to change Npc drop rates [PI]

item.title: [PI] How to change Npc drop rates [PI]
item.dc:creator: @thirdeye42 thirdeye42
item.description:
@thirdeye42 wrote:

Yes I know this post is well over a year old. I see no point in making a new post about the same thing.

[hr]

#Man drops
1:60 995:200 555:12 1620:1 1622:1 1624:1 995:450
1615:1 1969:1 1602:1

1 is the NPC ID. 60 I don’t know what it is. Maybe the % at which an item drops?

995:200 555:12 1620:1 1622:1 1624:1 995:450 Item IDs and the items quantity.

1615:1 1969:1 1602:1 Item IDs and the items quantity. These items are rare.

[hr]

Ok, so is this how this works or what? If so how do I change the rate at which an item drops?

Read full topic
